channel.title: How to make a clickable button? [PI]
channel.description:
Hey, I was wondering which class it's located in to make an area of an interface clickable? E.g. the inventory tab.
Thanks in advance. :rolleyes:

item.title: How to make a clickable button? [PI]

item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

TheHolyGrail:

I found it, it was server-sided. Thanks for trying to help though.

Should have posted the picture when creating the topic

item.title: How to make a clickable button? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

If I’m thinking what you’re thinking, you can go into the sprites and find one of those icons you don’t like, and you can paste

the icon that you want over it. Then you can edit the inside to what you want. If you would like to know how to edit the inside,

please tell me the base.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a clickable button? [PI]

item.title: How to make a clickable button? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @chri55w chri55w
item.description:
@chri55w wrote:

adding the button would be client sided however if you have a button already there that you want to make work then its server side

client sided:
rsInterface.java - you will need to find the add button method for your client then use it after locating the method for the interface you wish to add the button to (invent will be cached so will be difficult to add to)

server side -
clickingbuttons.java - you have to add a case for the button id then the code for what you want the button to do

i hope all this helps
chris

Read full topic
